Class Board

java.lang.Object
Board
public class Board extends Object
creates a chess board when we run the project and detects every pieces' movement
Author:
Deep Shah, Aryaman Patel

    • isPathClear

      public boolean isPathClear(int oldX, int oldY, int newX, int newY)
      Checks if the path is clear for each turn
      Parameters:
      oldX - , oldY, newX, newY: New and Old x and y coordinates to check if the path is clear to go from old coordinates to new ones
      Returns:
      boolean: true if path is clear and false if not clear

    • testCastling

      public boolean testCastling(int oldX, int oldY, int newX, int newY)
      checks if the castling is done correctly, and the chess pieces are in the correct place after castling
      Parameters:
      oldX - , oldY, newX, newY: New and Old x and y coordinates of king and rook to check if castling can happen
      Returns:
      boolean: true if castling can work and false if it cannot work

      public boolean testEnPassant(int oldX, int oldY, int newX, int newY)
      checks if the white is in check
      Parameters:
      oldX - , oldY, newX, newY: New and Old x and y coordinates to test the EnPassant with
      Returns:
      boolean: detects if enPassant is working or not

    • detectCheck

      public boolean detectCheck(boolean whiteturn)
      checks if the white is in check
      Parameters:
      whiteTurn - : check if it is white side's turn or black side's turn
      Returns:
      boolean: detects if black or white is in check or not

    • checkStalemate

      public boolean checkStalemate(boolean white)
      check if there is a stalemate
      Parameters:
      white - : if true then white, false then black
      Returns:
      boolean: true if there is a stalemate, false if there is not
